Data: Unsaved Changes Indication While Editing the Input Settings
This test case is to check the behavior of unsaved changes indication and set default functionality while editing the Input Settings.

Action:
1. Click PluginName (01) Plugin.Â 
2. Select the channel Page.
Expected Result:
# The PluginName (01) Plugin will be loaded.
 # There should not be any indication of unsaved changes and Set Default button should be disabled.

Action: Uncheck the Select all in the Input settings
Expected Result:
# All Channel are Unchecked.
# There should be indication of unsaved changes and Set Default button should be Enabled.

Action: check the Select all in the Input settings
Expected Result:
# All Channel are checked.
# There should not be any indication of unsaved changes and Set Default button should be Disabled

Action:
1. Uncheck the 
SecondChannel,
ThirdChannel,
FourthChannel
2. Edit the TwelfthChannel name to PowerInput
3. Edit the Refresh time to 2000
4. Change the SixthChannel unit to 'mA'
Expected Result:
1. SecondChannel,ThirdChannel,
FourthChannel parameters are unchecked, TwelfthChannel name edited and Refresh time changed to 2000
2.SixthChannel unit appeared as 'mA'
3. There should be indication of unsaved changes and Set Default button should be Enabled.

1. Revert the Input channel settings.
2. There should not be any indication of unsaved changes and Set Default button should be Disabled

Action:
1. Uncheck the SecondChannel,
FourthChannel.
2. Edit the TwelfthChannel name to PowerInput
3. Edit the Refresh time to 2000
4. Change the SixthChannel unit to 'mA'
Expected Result:
1. Input settings are edited.
2. There should be indication of unsaved changes and Set Default button should be Enabled.

Action: Save the configuration by clicking the Save button in the test configuration
Expected Result:
# Input settings are Saved.
# There should not be any indication of unsaved changes and Set Default button should be Disabled
